data.title: Shady management, avoid this place
data.text: It all begins with a rude staff. The staff here are not trained in customer service at all. Expect less than average service in all forms (sanitary included). This is more of a transient rest stop for people living in motels as a lifestyle rather than people on vacation or business trips. Apparently, them dealing with the undesirables they rent to has inspired the level of staff they hire. Avoid this place at all costs unless you are desperate and have low standards.

data.title: Slice of Heaven
data.text: Let me start off by saying this motel is very clean and is equivalent to the famous Howard Johnson motels. This vintage motel is a flashback of my visits to the Howard Johnson motels back in the 60s. This kitchenette suite was rented for me while I was visiting my family in Tustin, CA. The towels were fluffed upon request, while the toiletries were plentiful. The retro kitchenette was very clean and everything worked well. The bedroom was spacious had plenty of privacy for you and your significant other. The main room had a very comfortable futon, which would act as a luxury couch during family movie time and then later turn into a cozy bed for your admired children. I had plenty of closet space and hangers for my apparel and a lot of room my for my refrigerated goods in the mini fridge. The Bel Air Motor Motel is pet friendly, they even provided my dog with proper bedding. There is a park across the street, in which provided a safe playing environment for my two children. Convenient location for your next Disneyland trip. Your kids will fall in LOVE this hot spot!

data.title: The worst hotel/motel I have ever stayed at!!!!!!
data.text: This was the worst place I have ever stayed at.  It looked OK from the outside, but what a nightmare.  No ice, TV did not work, dirty, bugs, faulty lighting, no maid service, craby Mgr.  I know this is curt, but I don't want to spend a lot of time on this terrible place.  You have been warned!

data.title: Worst place ever
data.text: Went to check the place out but got yelled at by the manager. It was like we were bothering her.  I wanted info on the phone service provided because I didn't have a cell phone but she waived me off and stormed away. She was in the back room yelling that I was crazy. I wasn't going to get a room from her even if I wanted it.  I'm not sure what kind of place they operate but I'm glad I got away.

data.title: Flying roaches, manager yells a lot, place falling apart
data.text: The room was clean when we checked in but the pests are a deal breaker: 4 inch long cockroaches that fly when you try to swat them! You kill one, then there's 2 more coming at you! They even climb on the bed, found one crawling towards me. Some people call these waterbugs. Watch out they're in the bathroom as well! The place is in an ok location, the park right across has its plus & minuses as it can gets loud in there evenings & on the weekend. Place looks nice & vintage until you try to use the facilities: the telephone has too much static to hear anything, if you're lucky to get a dial tone! Shower had low flow, toilet backed up. The manager appears to work alone, beside the maid. There is no receptionist, phone calls to the front desk go unanswered, if you need something at night, you're out of luck! There is no security here either. I must add that this time we stayed in the hotel lobby building. The parking lot building is a lot nicer, has kitchenettes & we never saw any roaches when we stayed there a couple years back. The bathroom there gave us no problem. Manager yells a lot for no reason, she yelled at my girlfriend who came back in tears as she had to ask for assistance after 9pm & the manager yelled at her. We won't return here, 7 days was too long a stay.  Also a lot of partying going on nights & weekends. Not the place if you need to get some sleep.

data.title: If you don't mind huge flying cockroaches
data.text: The rooms are nice, very old motel has some charm. But it is infested by huge flying cockroaches that come out at night. I talked to other guests and they seem prevalent all year round in every room. You can see them as you enter the building at night, crawling around the entrance. We also had ants crawling inside our bed! At least it wasn't bed bugs. But those gigantic cockroaches gotta go! Tried to kill one with a shoe and it flew towards me. What horror! That was a lot worse that the weird going ons at night in the motel. No thanks!
